alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Coast; Willapa Hills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 11 at 1:22PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR PACIFIC AND WAHKIAKUM COUNTIES IN SOUTHWEST WASHINGTON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Washington, including the South Washington Coast and Willapa Hills. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. River rises on on the Naselle and Grays rivers have been slowing, but these rivers will continue to run high tonight into Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain will continue across western Washington through Wednesday. But, the area of heaviest rainfall will continue to shifting north of this area. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Coast; Willapa Hills
